1.text: Howbeit, Job, I pray thee, hear mine utterances, and hearken to all my words.

2.text: Behold now, I have opened my mouth, my tongue speaketh in my palate,

3.text: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart, and my lips shall utter knowledge purely.

4.text: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

5.text: If thou canst, answer me; array [thy words] before me: take thy stand.

6.text: Behold, before God I am as thou; I also am formed out of the clay.

7.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, nor my burden be heavy upon thee.

8.text: Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of [thy] words:—

9.text: I am clean without transgression; I am pure, and there is no iniquity in me;

10.text: Lo, he findeth occasions of hostility against me, he counteth me for his enemy;

11.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

12.text: Behold, I will answer thee in this, thou art not right; for +God is greater than man.

13.text: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

14.text: For God speaketh once, and twice,—[and man] perceiveth it not—

15.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

16.text: Then he openeth men’s ears, and sealeth their instruction,

17.text: That he may withdraw man [from his] work, and hide pride from man.

18.text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from passing away by the sword.

19.text: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and with constant strife in his bones;

20.text: And his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty food;

21.text: His flesh is consumed away from view, and his bones that were not seen stick out;

22.text: And his soul draweth near to the pit, and his life to the destroyers.

23.text: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his duty;

24.text: Then he will be gracious unto him, and say, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

25.text: His flesh shall be fresher than in childhood; he shall return to the days of his youth.

26.text: He shall pray unto +God, and he will receive him with favour; and he shall see his face with shoutings, and he will render unto man his righteousness.

27.text: He will sing before men, and say, I have sinned, and perverted what was right, and it hath not been requited to me;

28.text: He hath delivered my soul from going into the pit, and my life shall see the light.

29.text: Lo, all these [things] worketh God twice, thrice, with man,

30.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, that he may be enlightened with the light of the living.

31.text: Mark well, Job, hearken unto me; be silent, and I will speak.

32.text: If thou hast anything to say, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify thee.

33.text: If not, hearken thou unto me; be silent, and I will teach thee wisdom.
